en: Mike's mother lived in a big city before she married.
ko: 마이크네 어머니는 결혼하시기 전에 큰 도시에 사셨어.

en: According to Mike, Mac bought a new car.
ko: 마이크 말로는 맥이 새 차를 샀대.

en: Mike has a few friends in Florida.
ko: 마이크는 플로리다에 친구가 몇 명 있어.

en: Mike has two girl friends.

ko: 마이크랑 걔 여동생은 프랑스어는 할 줄 아는데 일본어는 못해.

en: Mike and Tom are in the same class.
Mike and David are always quarreling with each other over trifles.
ko: 마이크랑 데이비드는 항상 사소한 일로 투닥거려.

en: Mike and Ken are friends.

ko: 나 마이크인데, 히로시 좀 바꿔줄 수 있어?

en: Mike laughs.
It was this racket that Mike bought yesterday.
ko: 마이크가 어제 산 게 바로 이 라켓이야.

en: It is clear that Mike took the wrong bus.
ko: 마이크가 버스를 잘못 탄 게 분명해.

en: Mike cannot have done such a thing.
ko: 마이크가 그런 짓을 했을 리가 없어.

en: When Mike went to Jane's house, she was sleeping.
ko: 마이크가 제인네 집에 갔을 때 제인은 자고 있었어.

en: It was yesterday that Mike bought this racket.
ko: 마이크가 이 라켓을 산 건 어제였어.

en: Mike, do planes usually rock like this?

Did you hear that, Mike?
How are you, Mike?

ko: 고마워 마이크, 나 치킨 안 좋아해.

en: Well, you can't.
Well, it'll do for the time being.
That's fairly reasonable.
You sure gab a lot don't you? You're a natural born talker.
ko: 너 정말 수다쟁이다, 그치? 타고난 입담꾼이네.

en: Martin seemed very tired, didn't he?
Martin Luther King, Jr., a man of peace, was killed by an assassin's bullet.
ko: 평화주의자였던 마틴 루터 킹 주니어는 암살자의 총에 맞아 사망했어.

en: Martin Luther King, Jr. persuaded the black citizens to protest peacefully.
ko: 마틴 루터 킹 주니어는 흑인 시민들에게 평화롭게 시위하자고 설득했어.

en: Martin Luther King, Jr., had won his first protest against injustice - peacefully.
ko: 마틴 루터 킹 주니어는 불의에 맞선 첫 시위에서 평화롭게 승리했어.

en: Martin Luther King, Jr., was the son of a black minister.
ko: 마틴 루터 킹 주니어는 흑인 목사의 아들이었어.

en: Nobody could have guessed, in those days, the place in history that Martin Luther King, Jr. was to have.
ko: 그 시절엔 아무도 마틴 루터 킹 주니어가 역사에 어떤 발자취를 남길지 짐작조차 못 했을 거야.

en: Miss March gave me an English dictionary.
ko: 마치 선생님이 나한테 영어 사전을 주셨어.

en: Hurry up, Martin. We're already late!

Sit down and take it easy for a while.

ko: 마샤한테 그 얘기를 해줬더니 표정이 안 좋더라고.

en: Marcy burst into tears on hearing the news, but soon pulled herself together.
ko: 마시는 그 소식을 듣고 울음을 터뜨렸지만 곧 진정했어.

en: Martha is an excellent pianist.

ko: 1999년 1월 27일 화요일 오후에 샌프란시스코 공항 매리어트에서 마케팅 소위원회 대면 회의가 열릴 거야.

en: For your information, the marketing subcommittee is scheduling a phone conference to establish objectives and directions for 1998.
ko: 참고로 마케팅 소위원회에서 1998년 목표랑 방향을 잡으려고 전화 회의를 계획 중이야.

en: Scarcely had the market opened when the fire broke out.
Mark is the salt of the earth, so he can be trusted with a secret.
ko: 마크는 정말 진국이라 비밀을 믿고 털어놔도 돼.

en: Mark was a work horse on his construction crew.
ko: 마크는 건설 현장에서 진짜 소처럼 일했어.

en: Mark had never acted on the stage and he was ill at ease.
ko: 마크는 무대에 서 본 적이 없어서 되게 어색해했어.

en: Mark graduated from Harvard in 1991.
What a cute baby! May I hold her?
ko: 아기가 너무 귀엽네요! 한번 안아봐도 될까요?

en: Margaret is called Meg for short.
Margaret has a talent for music.
Margaret, whose father you met last Sunday, is a very good tennis player.
ko: 지난 일요일에 아버님 뵀던 그 마거릿 말이야, 테니스 정말 잘 쳐.

en: Oh no, really?
I made up my mind to get married to Margaret.
I'll tell you what.
Oh, you'll get used to it soon!
All in all, this was a nice party.
Well, just you wait and see.
I sort of like him.
Well, I'll be damned!
Gosh, what a dirty customer!
Oh, come off it.
ko: 에이, 말도 안 되는 소리 하지 마.

en: Oh, it's very kind of you to say so.
My, but you're nice.
Oh, my God!
Oh, what is this?
I guess we could.
I'll give it some thought.
I'm kind of happy.
Boil the milk bottles.

ko: 운전 대충 하면 꺾어야 할 데 놓쳐.

en: Don't look away idly; just pay attention to what you're doing.
ko: 한눈팔지 말고 네가 하는 일에나 집중해.

en: If you didn't have your head in the clouds, you could succeed.
ko: 뜬구름 잡는 소리 그만하면 성공할 수 있을 거야.

en: Hong Myong Bo is a great player.
The pump did not act as it should have.
Mr Hopkins spoke in such a loud voice that I could hear him upstairs.
ko: 홉킨스 씨 목소리가 워낙 커서 위층까지 다 들렸어.

en: The price of books is getting higher these days.
Can I pay for the book by check?
I missed the train by only one minute.
Only a few students understood the matter.
ko: 학생들 몇 명만 그 내용을 이해했어.

en: I am only joking.
It is nothing but a joke.
Only a handful of people know the fact.
ko: 그 사실을 아는 사람은 극히 드물어.

en: I need a bit of sugar.

ko: 내 말을 이해해 준 사람은 몇 안 됐어.

He is but a child.

en: I don't want to put her to even a small inconvenience.
ko: 걔한테 조금도 폐 끼치고 싶지 않아.

en: You must give close attention to the merest details.
ko: 아주 사소한 디테일까지 신경 써야 해.

en: Just a word can do harm to a person.
ko: 말 한마디로 사람한테 상처 줄 수 있어.

en: Only a handful of men want to take childcare leave.
